summary: Anne Paul Wilander was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents primarily consist of payroll records and certifications detailing her employment, position, and salary during her time with the committee. These records span from June 1977 to March 1979, indicating her period of employment with the HSCA. The documents include payroll authorization forms, certification reports, and payroll certifications, all related to her compensation and employment status within the committee. The redaction of her Social Security number in one document suggests privacy concerns related to personnel records.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Anne Paul Wilander's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the committee's operations during a critical period of its investigation.
